About.heading: Our Mission
About.description: The Romanian Cultural Center in Norway is a vibrant community dedicated to preserving and promoting Romanian cultural heritage in the heart of Norway.

mission.title: What We Do
mission.description: We provide a welcoming space where Romanians and friends of Romanian culture can connect, learn, and celebrate together. From cultural events to language courses, we build bridges between our traditions and modern Norwegian life.

event1.title: Adventure in Sirdal Program - Free Camps
event1.description: Themed camps (winter in January and summer on Children's Day) in Sirdal. Accommodation, educational activities in Romanian, team games, and nature survival workshops. Members have priority registration and free access.

event2.title: Living Heritage Workshops - Culture and Crafts
event2.description: Monthly themed sessions: Union (January), Brâncuși (February), Mărțișor (March). Creative workshops, interactive presentations about great Romanians, and artistic moments (dance, music). Children learn history in a playful way.

event3.title: Integration Hub "Navigating Norway"
event3.description: Workshops on Norwegian CV, interviews, labor rights, tax system, and documentary screenings. Access to verified resources and network of professionals who help you avoid costly beginner mistakes.

event4.title: Healthy Community Program - Prevention
event4.description: Health education events: World Heart Day, healthy lifestyle in Nordic climate, moral support for newcomers. Lectures with specialists and active community support for everyone's well-being.
